threads.@countofst.germain6417 23 hours ago: Janus: This likely refers to the Roman god Janus, who is typically depicted with two faces looking in opposite directions. In the context of text-to-video models, "Janus" might symbolize a video that appears to have conflicting or dual aspects—essentially, it's trying to show two different things at once.

threads.@tatianasearle3470 12 hours ago: Stable Diffusion 3 is actually Amazing. Two reasons: 1. Stable Diffusion is not really meant to be used by itself. It is usually combined with filters, which handle lighting and composition in a particular way, or sometimes help emulate an art style. So a "base model" that produces "boring" results is the best, as it means any filters people create for it will make a big difference! 2. There is a very important difference between different models, that I like to call "variability". Models with low variability have very good prompt adherence, very good text rendering and are less likely to deform or duplicate body parts. So SD3 was deliberately made with super-low variability, because the devs know that filters which increase it can be made.
